58 Anna Unger

Summary

Biography

Senior Year (2022)

Stats: Played in 17 games starting all of them…recorded a 3.87 goals-against average and a .599 save percentage in 246 minutes in goal…also tallied 88 saves.

Best Games: Recorded four saves in Colgate’s season-opening victory at Merrimack (Aug. 27)...stopped nine shots in the Raiders’ win over Bryant (Sept. 2) earning Patriot League Goalkeeper of the Week….tallied nine saves against Yale (Sept. 16)...logged 75 minutes of action and recorded nine stops in overtime game against Vermont (Oct. 2)...picked up victory over Stonehill (Oct. 11)...made five stops at Lehigh (Oct. 29) in final game as a Raider.

Honors: Patriot League Goalkeeper of the Week (Sept. 5).

Senior Year (2021)

Stats: Started all 14 of the Raiders’ games…made 109 saves…posted a .690 save percentage and 3.56 GAA…logged 871 minutes.

Best Games: Made a career-high 18 saves at Yale (Sept. 18) …. recorded 14 stops against Cornell (Oct. 3) …tied her career-high with another 18 saves at No. 7 Syracuse (Oct. 10) …tallied seven saves and earned win at Towson (Oct. 24) …. also stopped seven shots against No. 17 American (Oct. 30)

Honors: Earned a spot on the NFHCA National Academic Squad … also named to the Patriot League Academic Honor Roll.

Junior Year (2020-21)

Stats: Started all five games for the Raiders … recorded a 1.22 goals against average and .833 save percentage over the course of 294:56 of action in the cage … posted a 2-3-0 record … recorded on shutout … tallied 30 saves and just six goals against.

Best Games: Earned third career shutout behind eight saves in the 1-0 win against Holy Cross (March 21) … opened with a season-high of 11 saves in the 2-1 win at Bucknell (March 7), helping the Raiders to their best 2-0 start in the Patriot League since 2014.

Honors: Named to Second Team All-Patriot League accolades … earned Patriot League Goalkeeper of the Week on March 8 … named to the NFHCA National Academic Squad … earned a spot on the Raider Academic Honor Roll ... her 1.22 GAA this season ranked fourth-best in program history.

Sophomore Year (2019)

Stats: Appeared in all 17 games, making 16 starts for the Raiders … recorded a 2-13-0 overall record in goal … marked 86 saves, with 47 goals against through 852:25 of action … completed the season with a 3.31 goals against average and .647 save %.

Best Games: Recorded her second career shutout in a 1-0 victory at Bryant (Nov. 3) behind seven saves … posted a season-high 12 saves against then-No. 19 Syracuse (Sept. 22) … tallied two goals against or less in six games this season … played in 10 complete 60:00 games.

Honors: Named to the Patriot League Honor Roll ... earned a spot on the NFHCA National Academic Squad ... named to the Raider Academic Honor Roll.

Freshman Year (2018)

Stats: Appeared in 14 of the Raiders 18 games on the season and started on 12 occasions … tallied 39 goals against and 72 saves in her debut season … had an overall record of 2-9-0 with a 3.26 goals against average and .678 save percentage.

Best Games: Recorded first career shutout in her first collegiate game, a 1-0 overtime win against Central Michigan where she made five saves (Aug. 24) … posted a career-high of 11 saves at Albany (Sept. 1) … also marked double-digit saves with 10 against Pacific (Sept. 20) … played the full 70:00 in eight games.

Honors: Earned first Patriot League award in her career after a seven-save performance and 2-0 start against Central Michigan and LIU Brooklyn, being named Patriot League Goalkeeper of the Week on Aug. 27 … Named to Patriot League Honor Roll … Named to Raider Academic Honor Roll.

Before Colgate

Graduates from St. Agnes Academy in 2018…Lettered in field hockey and soccer…Member of the National Honor Society…Also member of Bollywood Dance Club, Autism Awareness Club, Fight Like a Girl Club and Kaleidoscope Club.

Stats: Made 143 saves on 166 shots for an .880 save percentage as a senior…Tallied 752 saves on 864 shots throughout her collegiate career for an .870 save percentage.

Honors: Selected to the U-19 USA Field Hockey Junior National Camp in 2017…Listed as one of Max Field Hockey's Class of 2018 Top 100 Players in 2017…Three-time Academic All-State from 2015-17…Regional All-American in 2016…Harrow/NFHCA High School All-Region Team in 2016…Region 10 NFC U-16 Team Selection in 2016…Region 10 NFC U-19 Team Selection in 2017…Team MVP in 2017…Team's Most Outstanding Defensive Player in 2016.

Personal

Born: Full name is Anna Elizabeth Unger…Born in Magnitogorsk, Russia.

Family: Parents are John Unger and Kathy Welch…Has one brother.

No stats available for the current season.
